result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety unless valid prescription.
Any contact with victim S.P. may only be at the PO's discretion.
Any continuing assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF108, 14CF677 and 15CF9 called: 2:51pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Dave Casey.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed

State moves to:
15CF9 - Cts. 1, 3, and 4>> D&RI
15CF108 - Cts. 2, 4, and 6-13 inclusive>> D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
14CF677 - Ct. 1 (DC/DA/DA Repeater)>>GUILTY
15CF9 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF9 - Ct. 5 (DC/DA/DA Repeater)>>GUILTY
15CF108 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF108 - Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF108 - Ct. 5 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF677 - Ct. 1 and 15CF9 - Ct. 5 (all DC/DA/DA Repeater counts)>> on each count, 2 years TOTAL: 1 year incarceration and 1 year ES, concurrent to each other.
15CF9 - Ct. 2, 15CF108 Cts. 1, 3, and 5 (all Felony BJ counts)>> on each count, 6 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES, concurrent to each other and to both counts above.
CREDIT as follows:
14CF677 Ct. 1>>0 credit
15CF09>>208 days credit  on each count
15CF108>>175 days credit on each count

CONDITIONS of ES>>Any continuing assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety unless as validly prescribed; Any contact with victim S.P. may only be at the PO's discretion; CC including DNA surcharges.

>>>Defendant IS eligible for both CIP and SAP in all counts
Defendant is remanded to sheriffs dept for transport to Dodge Correctional

Case called: 10:05am. INCLUDES 14CF677, 15CF9, 15CF108. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Mike Puerner. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Pauline Toulouse. State indicates Matter was set for Arraignment and Mtn to Amend Complaint in 15CF9. Atty Toulouse did not file Mtn to Amend Complaint and moves orallly to amend cts 3, 4 & 5 in 15CF9 before proceeding with Arraignment. Arguments by Atty Toulouse. State provides case law to the Court to review.  COURT makes findings and denies Mtn to Amend Complaint 15CF9. Crt proceeds with Arraignment in 15CF9. W/R. Plea: NOT GUILTY in 15CF9. Bond to Continue. State has additionally filed new charges in 15CF108. Crt proceeds with Initial Appearance. Plea: Not Guilty on misd cts. State requests $10,000 cash bond with non waivable no contact order with S.P. Arguments. COURT ORDERS: Cash Bond $10,000 15CF108; Non Waivable No Contact with S.P.  Address: 424 N 4trh Ave Wausau WI 54401Atty Toulouse moves to amend bond in 15CF9 - crt denies. Crt notes No Contact Order in 15CF9. DATES: Prelim 2/11/15 @ 9:20am BR 5. CC: BR 1 & 5. . Adjourned: 10:23am.

Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.   No contact with victim(s): S.P. (can be waived in the DA's office). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No violent or abusive contact. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center. Take prescription drugs as prescribed.
